title: Slow Cooker Cowboy Casserole
description: This slow cooker cowboy casserole is a family-friendly, budget-friendly layered casserole of ground beef, sliced potatoes, and Cheddar cheese. It's easy to put together and let the slow cooker do the rest.
ingredients: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook lean ground beef and onion over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is soft and translucent, 6 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir soup and milk together in a bowl.

Line a slow cooker with a slow cooker bag. Place a layer of potatoes, overlapping as needed, at the bottom of slow cooker. Season with salt and pepper. Top with a layer of ground beef, a layer of soup mixture and 1 cup cheese. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients.
Cook on High until potatoes are fork tender, 3 to 4 hours.
tips: For a healthier version, you can substitute lean ground turkey for the beef and use low-fat cheese.

structured_content.content: This slow cooker cowboy casserole is a family-friendly, budget-friendly layered casserole of ground beef, sliced potatoes, and Cheddar cheese. It's easy to put together and let the slow cooker do the rest.
This recipe was passed down from my grandmother, who was a true cowboy at heart. She loved to prepare this dish for our family gatherings.

• Ground Beef: This forms the base of the casserole and provides a hearty, meaty flavor.
  • Potatoes: These are sliced and layered in the casserole, providing a satisfying, starchy component.

Brown the Beef:
Cook lean ground beef and onion over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is soft and translucent, 6 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper.
Layer the Ingredients:
Line a slow cooker with a slow cooker bag. Place a layer of potatoes, overlapping as needed, at the bottom of slow cooker. Season with salt and pepper. Top with a layer of ground beef, a layer of soup mixture and 1 cup cheese. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients.

upload.context: A delicious slow cooker cowboy casserole with layers of ground beef, potatoes, and cheese.

note.label: Things to Keep in Mind
note.content:
• Ensure the potatoes are sliced thinly so they cook evenly.
  • For a creamier casserole, you can add more milk or cream to the soup mixture.

structured_content.content: This recipe always brings back fond memories of family gatherings at my grandmother's house. It's a comfort food classic that never fails to please.
Add some smoked paprika or cayenne pepper to the beef for an extra kick. You can also add some diced bell peppers or mushrooms for additional flavor and texture.
This casserole is perfect on its own, but you can also serve it with a side of green beans or a fresh salad. For a complete meal, pair it with a glass of red wine.
Try substituting the ground beef with ground turkey or chicken for a lighter version. You can also use sweet potatoes instead of regular potatoes for a sweet and savory twist.

note.label: Chef's Suggestions
note.content:
• For a richer flavor, try using a blend of cheeses such as Cheddar and Monterey Jack.

structured_content.content: Enjoy this hearty and comforting Slow Cooker Cowboy Casserole. It's sure to become a family favorite!
